title: Print, "Projet de l'Autel de l'Eglise de St. Aignan d'Orleans (Design for the Altar of the Church of St. Aignan of Orleans), plate 102, from Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)", 1748
signed: Signed in plate, lower left: J. A. Meissonnier inv.;
inscribed: Inscribed in plate, upper left: R; upper right: 102; lower center: Elevation geometrale du projet de l'Autel de l'Eglise de St. Aignan d'Orleans / avec la chasse dargent du d. Saint. / A Paris chés Huquier rue St. Jacque au coin de celle des Mathurins. C.P.R.
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Altar flanked by heavily decorated elements with putti heads and hanging lamps. Stairs lead up to the altar where six candlesticks stand, at center a cross decorated with figures and putti; above, a figure holds a lamp from a vine. Canopied by an arch decorated with figures and topped with a triangle from which sunrays emanate encircled by clouds and putti.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "Projet de l'Autel de l'Eglise de St. Aignan d'Orleans (Design for the Altar of the Church of St. Aignan of Orleans), plate 102, from Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)", 1748.
1748. Engraving on white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1921-6-212-60.
